body:
Thanks for filing this issue @jimthompson5802.

Offhand, I don't see what the root cause should be, but thanks for pinpointing the specific PR that introduced the regression!

The configs, aside from new required parameters, look identical. The ECD architecture also looks identical.

Perhaps there's something that changed in the training process.

CC: @jppgks

Not sure if this helps but here is another piece of the puzzle.  

If one instruments the code in `train_step()` after the `optimizer.step()` call to display parameter weights, I can see the weights change during training.

However, if the model parameters are displayed right after training, the parameter values do not match the parameter values in the last batch of the FINAL epoch.   

From what I can see the model parameter values after training are equal to the parameter values displayed in the last bach of the FIRST epoch.

Somehow when the `predict()` method is retrieving  non-current parameter weights.

issue.title: Fix: Don't skip saving the model if the save path already exists.
issue.body:
Without this change, the model is only saved the first time `save()` is called (at the end of the first round of evaluation).

This is a bug that was introduced in #2027. This was not caught by any model loading unit tests like `tests/integration_tests/test_model_save_and_load.py` because the best saved weights are reloaded automatically at the end of `train()`, so there's never a discrepancy between the model returned from `train()` and models loaded from disk.

@jimthompson5802 will send a follow up PR that adds a test that catches this regression specifically.

Closes #2259
